articles.author: Maya Gebeily, James Mackenzie, John Irish
articles.description: The Paris conference aims to mobilise both humanitarian aid and support for the Lebanese military.
articles.title: Israeli strike kills Lebanese troops as France rallies support for army

articles.author: Tassilo Hummel, Tom Balmforth, Maria Martinez
articles.description: Ukraine's bid to have Russia added to an international list of countries with weak money laundering compliance has failed again after the move was rejected by countries including China, India, Saudi Arabia and South Africa, three sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Ukraine's bid to add Russia to FATF's 'black list' fails again, rejected by China, India and others

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: In Uruguay's capital Montevideo and around this South American nation of 3.4 million people, voters are gearing up for Sunday's election, overshadowed by a plebiscite on pensions the same day and fears over crime.
articles.title: Uruguay set for election dominated by pensions, crime

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The International Criminal Court (ICC) on Friday announced it would replace on health grounds one of the judges deciding on a prosecution request to issue an arrest warrant for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, a move that could spark further delays in the case.
articles.title: ICC replaces on health grounds judge mulling request for Netanyahu arrest warrant

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France's National Assembly on Friday approved an amendment to the government's 2025 belt-tightening budget bill that would hit the country's wealthiest individuals with a billionaires tax.
articles.title: French lower house approves budget amendment to tax billionaires

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea said on Friday any move to send its troops to assist Russia in its war in Ukraine would be in line with international law, although it stopped short of confirming that such a deployment had taken place.
articles.title: North Korea says any deployment to aid Russia would be lawful

articles.author: Mike Stone, Gerry Doyle
articles.description: Fearing China will deploy hypersonic weapons to sink ships in the Pacific, the U.S. Navy is moving forward with a plan to arm some of its vessels with Patriot interceptor missiles, two senior defense officials said.
articles.title: Fearing China's hypersonic weapons, US Navy seeks to arm ships with Patriot missiles

articles.author: David Lawder, David Milliken
articles.description: British finance minister Rachel Reeves told Reuters on Friday that the U.S.-Britain relationship will remain strong no matter whether Republican former President Donald Trump or Democratic Vice President Kamala Harris wins the Nov. 5 U.S. election.
articles.title: British finance minister sees strong US-UK relationship whether Trump or Harris wins

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexico's Senate on Friday passed a proposal which would make reforms to the Constitution "unchallengeable" as ruling party Morena and allies push through a swath of constitutional reforms, including a controversial judicial overhaul.
articles.title: Mexican Senate passes proposal to block challenges to constitutional reforms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy has rejected a plan for the U.N. Secretary General to visit Kyiv due to Antonio Guterres's attendance at this week's BRICS summit in Russia, a Ukrainian official said on Friday.
articles.title: Zelenskiy rejects UN chief's plan to visit Kyiv over Russia trip, source says
